data.title: create_automatic_images webp
data.body:
please add webp-format to the create_automatic_images (00obsolete.rpy)
for example:
```
...
# Only .png and .jpg and .webp
if not fn.lower().endswith(".png") and not fn.lower().endswith(".jpg") and not fn.lower().endswith(".webp"):
    continue
# Strip the extension, replace slashes.
if fn.lower().endswith(".webp"):
    shortfn = fn[:-5]
else:
    shortfn = fn[:-4]
shortfn = shortfn.replace("\\", "/")
...
```

data.title: Jpeg format is ignored by renpy functions
data.body: While renpy supports jpeg files just like it supports jpg, functions like has_image don't see jpeg pictures.

data.title: 6.99.13 Prerelease TODO
data.body:
- [x] Allow Say to take arguments.
- [x] Global say argument callback.
- [x] Provide a way for character to not allow clicking. (To allow hyperlinked dialogue.)

- [x] #1228 _history_list.voice.filename will be None if Voice Sustain is on
- [x] #1225 show at nullifies transition.
- [x] #1214 Inconsistent newline style.
- [x] #1204 Better error message (done, needs to be closed at prerelease)
- [x] #1181 ATL transform bug relating to "on show" and "on hide"
- [x] #1174 Blocking when sound plays. (Can't repeat.)
- [x] #1171 Answer question.
- [x]  #1113 Scaling window make text in Help goes out-of-frame (new GUI)

- [x] screen game_menu should take yinitial as an argument.
- [x] Really tiny launcher errors.
- [x] Changelog say-with-attributes.
- [x] Ensure itch/butler work well.
- [x] https://lemmasoft.renai.us/forums/ucp.php?i=pm&mode=view&f=0&p=260161
- [x]  pop_nvl_list fires when rolling back, so entries get missing or it crashes when rolling back to the start of a page
- [ ] Sound volume issue.
- [x] Navigate script button gives an error.
- [x] show layer at resetting?

data.title: Updating russian translation
data.body:
Beside some changes in translation and updating translation.rst, there is one little change in tutorial itself:

Original:
"To break a line without pausing,\none can write \\n, \\' and \\\" include quotes in the text."

New:
"To break a line without pausing,\none can write \\n. \\' and \\\" include quotes in the text."

Otherwise, I understand this as "you can break a line with \\'  and \\\"…" and didn't understand "include quotes in the text".

data.title: IOError: [Errno 13] Permission denied: 'files.txt'
data.body:
It seems like the developer code of Ren'Py is deny acess to create the files.txt that list the names of the imagens inside game folder. This error is messing me up a lot...
You can see the bug here
[traceback.txt](https://github.com/renpy/renpy/files/1248801/traceback.txt)

data.title: _history_list.voice.filename will be None if Voice Sustain is on
If action executes both possible commands before choosing the appropriate one
data.body:
`If((bkg_page+1)>21,SetVariable('scene_background', gallery_bkg_items[0]),SetVariable('scene_background', gallery_bkg_items[bkg_page+1]))`

gallery_bkg_items is a list filled with 22 renpy images, indexed from 0 to 21.
bkg_page is the current gallery page.

`SetVariable('scene_background', gallery_bkg_items[bkg_page+1])`
Above code will fail when bkg_page is equal to 21, because scene_background attempts to index into the nonexistent 22 cell of gallery_bkg_items.

I attempted to solve this by placing that code in an if statement, which should ensure it only runs when bkg_page is less than 21. This is throwing the same error as before, implying that If() action is still running that snippet prior to choosing a course of action.

Code works fine in a normal if statement; the sole issue seems to be with the If(condition,result,result) action. I can't use traditional if statements because I'm embedding this code into an ImageButton.

Full error traceback attached below:
[error.txt](https://github.com/renpy/renpy/files/1237590/error.txt)

data.title: Custom path failed on Android  by prefix x-
data.body:
When building apk  renPy will add "x-" prefix to every file/folder  

This cause a problem when i try to load some file in python mode (4 example language)
`...`
`tl_dir = os.path.join(config.gamedir, "tl") # I have tl folder in my gamedir `
`...`
(this work perfectly on PC)

but when we go to android everything changed ,tl floder was renamed into x-tl by renPy
and game failed to load those resource

change os.path.join(config.gamedir, "tl")  into os.path.join(config.gamedir, "x-tl")  fix nothing because renPy refuced to build

data.title: show layer master at tr_shake nullifies renpy.transition(dissolve)
data.body:
Looks like if you shake the screen using

show layer master at tr_shake

then, renpy.transition(dissolve) stops working to dissolve live composite characters.

tr_shake is just

    transform tr_shake:
        ease 0.02 xpos -0.02
        ease 0.04 xpos 0.02
        ease 0.02 xpos 0.0
        repeat 4

data.title: Updating russian translation and some more notes.
data.body:
Well, I found some more issues and sorting them:

# Tutorial. 
# Example window not translating. 
I think, this is because of using variables and text tags.
- eslow "The nw tag causes Ren'Py to continue past slow text,{nw}" ### english example. next string is russian, lol
- e "To interpolate a variable, write it in square brackets. Isn't that right, [name]?" ### english example
- e "Variable interpolation also works with other variables. Here, the answer is [answer] and the flag is [flag]." ### example no translation
- old "The answer is [answer]." ### english example
- old "Text tags {color=#c8ffc8}work{/color} in screens." ### english example
- e "For example, we might want to have text that is {b}bold{/b}, {i}italic{/i}, {s}struckthrough{/s}, or {u}underlined{/u}." ### english example
- e "The a text tag {a=https://www.renpy.org}links to a website{/a}." ### english example
- e "The alpha text tag makes text {alpha=.5}translucent{/alpha}." ### english example
- e "The color text tag changes the {color=#0080c0}color{/color} of the text." ### english example
- e "The cps text tag {cps=25}makes text type itself out slowly{/cps}, even if slow text is off." ### english example
- e "The cps tag can also be relative to the default speed, {cps=*2}doubling{/cps} or {cps=*0.5}halving{/cps} it." ### english example
- e "The font tag changes the font, for example to {font=DejaVuSans-Bold.ttf}DejaVuSans-Bold.ttf{/font}." ### english example
- e "Sometimes, changing to a bold font looks better than using the {{b} tag." ### english example
- e "The k tag changes kerning. It can space the letters of a word {k=-.5}closer together{/k} or {k=.5}farther apart{/k}." ### english example
- e "The size tag changes the size of text. It can make text {size=+10}bigger{/size} or {size=-10}smaller{/size}, or set it to a {size=30}fixed size{/size}." ### english example
- e "The space tag {space=30} adds horizontal space in text.{vspace=30}The vspace tag adds vertical space between lines." ### english example
- e "The p tag breaks a paragraph,{p}and waits for the player to click." ### english example
- e "If it is given a number as an argument,{p=1.5}it waits that many seconds." ### english example
- e "The w tag also waits for a click,{w} except it doesn't break lines,{w=.5} the way p does." ### english example
- e "When the variable name is followed by !t, it is translated to [variable!t]. It could be something else in a different language." ### здесь должно быть translatable!t ### english example
- e "When the variable name is followed by !t, it is translated to [variable!t]. It could be something else in a different language." ### здесь должно быть translatable!t ### english example
- e "Finally, certain characters are special. [[, {{, and \\ need to be doubled if included in text. The %% character should be doubled if used in dialogue." ### english example
- e "For example, this displays the [variable!t]." ### english example
- e "When the variable name is followed by !q, special characters are quoted. This displays the raw [variable!q], including the italics tags." ### english example 

# variable!q!t
- e "When the variable name is followed by !q, special characters are quoted. This displays the raw [variable!q], including the italics tags." ### btw, set it to [variable!q!t] in original for translation measures. Otherwise it can be english raw text only.

# Where are displayable statements?
I just don't understand where to send tutorial player =D
- e "The screen language has a few statements that do things other than show displayables. If you haven't seen the displayable statements yet, you might want to check them out and come back here."

# Interactive Director. 
# String ID.
String ID take too much space. For example, in director part of the turorial string ID (left side) pushed strings themself right, so now string ID in the center of separating line. Watch it on screenshot.
- e "Let's add a background. Click the '+' to pick where to add it, then the 'scene' statement and 'washington' for the image. Finally, click 'Add' to add it." ### string ID take too much space

# Launcher 
- I still watching this (https://github.com/renpy/renpy/issues/1113) bug. Less now, but some symbols just keep go out-of-frame. "Пробел" after "Enter" on screenshot.

![pythonw_2017-08-04_20-14-39](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/24704640/28979259-d33d2502-7951-11e7-8683-d0ce84116b29.png)
![pythonw_2017-08-04_20-15-12](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/24704640/28979260-d3638b70-7951-11e7-8de8-ace019d3f557.png)

data.body:
Can we make this work? 
```
$ renpy.say(e, "Hello, world.")
extend " Hello, world 2."
```
I haven't look at the renpy.say code but it looks like _last_say_who & _last_say_what doesn't get exported!? 
```

﻿I'm sorry, but an uncaught exception occurred.

While running game code:
  File "game/script.rpy", line 59, in script
    extend " Hello, world 2."
  File "renpy/common/00library.rpy", line 130, in extend
    what = _last_say_what + config.extend_interjection + _last_raw_what

-- Full Traceback ------------------------------------------------------------

Full traceback:

    extend " Hello, world 2."
  File "/home/xxxx/RenPy/renpy-nightly/renpy/ast.py", line 613, in execute
    renpy.exports.say(who, what, interact=self.interact)
  File "/home/xxxx/RenPy/renpy-nightly/renpy/exports.py", line 1151, in say
    who(what, interact=interact)
  File "renpy/common/00library.rpy", line 130, in extend

TypeError: unsupported operand type(s) for +: 'NoneType' and 'unicode'

Linux-4.4.0-87-generic-x86_64-with-debian-stretch-sid
Ren'Py 6.99.13.2606
```

data.title: Grid could use separate horizontal and vertical spacing
data.body: Currently grid statement only allows to set equal spacing between rows and columns. I'd like to set vertical spacing bigger than horizontal. There's no straightforward way to do so except maybe using for loop over hboxes in a vbox instead of grid.

data.title: Improve compatibility support for games built with older renpy
data.body:
The problem with Katawa Shoujo is quite known it at least two distributions: when people want to use the latest RenPy the game fails to start:
https://bugs.gentoo.org/show_bug.cgi?id=601200
https://aur.archlinux.org/packages/katawa-shoujo/

The second problem with ElvenRelations was found when looping through my local RenPy games collection.

The third change increases hardcoded values for the infinite loop check: on older hardware it triggers on valid games. Better solution will be to depend this values on CPU frequency/number of cores/generation or make it user configurable.

Commit messages describe both problems and solutions with greater detail. RenPy used for testing is the latest official release 6.99.12.4, though it looks like affected code was not changed in git HEAD.

data.title: Configurable CPS (text speed) range
data.body:
The default CPS slider in the preferences screen is intended for English, which is way too fast for Asian languages (I have to set it at 20% while it is already fast enough).

It would be good to make the range adjustable in `options.rpy`, or simply provide a switch for Asian vs English-like languages. I guess the same fact may also affect autoplay speed.

data.title: Inconsistent newline style with new GUI template
data.body:
tldr, results:
```
find . -name "*.rpy" | xargs file
./game/gui.rpy:     UTF-8 Unicode (with BOM) text, with CRLF line terminators
./game/screens.rpy: UTF-8 Unicode (with BOM) text, with CRLF line terminators
./game/options.rpy: UTF-8 Unicode (with BOM) text, with CRLF line terminators
./game/script.rpy:  UTF-8 Unicode (with BOM) text
```

Also this.

```
./game/tl/None/common.rpym: UTF-8 Unicode (with BOM) text, with CRLF, LF line terminators
```

I'm using Japanese language for the launcher. Version is `Ren'Py 6.99.12.4.2187`.

I think there's some conversion made. Here's the results about source:

```
find /usr/share/renpy/gui -name "*.rpy" | xargs file
/usr/share/renpy/gui/game/testcases.rpy:  ASCII text
/usr/share/renpy/gui/game/script.rpy:     ASCII text
/usr/share/renpy/gui/game/screens.rpy:    UTF-8 Unicode text
/usr/share/renpy/gui/game/options.rpy:    UTF-8 Unicode (with BOM) text
/usr/share/renpy/gui/game/guisupport.rpy: Python script, ASCII text executable
/usr/share/renpy/gui/game/gui.rpy:        ASCII text
```

From the conventions of Git, I would like to suggest to convert to CRLF depending on platform.

IMO, adding BOM just makes it invalid ASCII and resulting in junk first byte in some UNIX commands. It should be omitted for UTF-8.

data.title: Unexpected behavior when setting character's what_args["slow_abortable"] to False
data.body:
You're probably going to hate me for this, because the "slow_abortable" property was probably put out of use a very long time ago. But I noticed when setting `what_args["slow_abortable"]` to `False`, clicking the mouse advances to the next line even when slow is still in progress. The culprit is in `text.py`:
```python
if self.slow and renpy.display.behavior.map_event(ev, "dismiss") and self.style.slow_abortable:
    self.call_slow_done(st)
    self.slow = False
    raise renpy.display.core.IgnoreEvent()
```
If we're in `slow`, then `renpy.display.core.IgnoreEvent()` should be raised whether or not `slow_abortable` is `True`.

```python
if self.slow and renpy.display.behavior.map_event(ev, "dismiss"):
    if self.style.slow_abortable:
        self.call_slow_done(st)
        self.slow = False
    raise renpy.display.core.IgnoreEvent()
```
If we do this, then the same behavior is elicited when `slow_abortable` is `True`, but if `False` then the event is ignored, and dismiss does nothing.

But if you're more in favor of just removing `slow_abortable` then I would appreciate you clarifying that anyway.

data.title: (Request) Solving problems with default options in Renpy persistent
data.body:
Well, I get project with "Can't multiply sequence by non-int of type 'float'" error and I should fix this… Of course, lint not helped at all.

Briefly, problem was in "config.default_text_cps = **0,5**" and that wasn't easy to find that **0,5** must be **0.5** or better **0**… Creator change this parameter after starting projects first time (so, options was written in persistent), so it works well on creator's computer. And this is longreadtext of how I search this bug, so you can pass it:
(first time i made this project works on my computer and sent project to creator… second time i'll ask creator for full reinstall Renpy (cause it's strange, when something not works only on others computers. And, well, i find some new files, that mustn't exists in newest Renpy)… third time i got enough of this sxit, made new project and MELD (compared) directories of base project and target project and found this "," at last!).

So, I think that Renpy needs some method of checking nonpersistent project environment workability, cause it can prevent creating projects that works only on native computer (with persistents)… or make lint better again.
